result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Moefu is heard on the status of the case. Requests a plea and sentencing.

records.addlTxt: Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:18 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven A Burr in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lui Moefu appeared by video for Steven A Burr. 

22CM04 and 22CM34 called. 

Attorney Lui Moefu is heard on the two cases tracking together for a global resolution. 
Court approves petition for court appointed attorney.  

Court orders in 22CM34 that Attorney Lui Moefu will be appointed Attorney in both cases. Wage assignment will apply to both cases.

22CM34 - Attorney Lui Moefu is ready to proceed with arraignment. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State Public Defender's Office indicates that Mr. Burr phoned their our office and at this time he does not qualify for a public defender.

1:36 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven A Burr not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard on non appearance of defendant. 
Court orders a warrant and defendant to be held for further proceedings.

1:39 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven A Burr in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Defendant gives status on retaining an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:15 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Steven A Burr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court finds probable cause.
     D.A. notes $450 already posted in other case with same victim; requests bond of $450 cash and prohibits any contact with K.H.
     Def. comments; requests $200 cash bond.  D.A. responds.
     Court comments.  Court orders bond as requested; orders $450 cash with condition to have no contact with K. Hamilton.  Def. advised of right to an atty.
     Court concludes at 1:21 p.m.
Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
